intro: Mentha arvensis var. lanceolata, commonly known as narrow-leaf mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and strong, aromatic mint scent. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has square stems with opposite leaves. It produces small, pale blue or purple flowers in clusters, which are attractive to pollinators. This variety is often used in culinary and medicinal applications due to its essential oils and refreshing flavor.
